fields.summary: Possibility to have a subtask work chain

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29671].
  {panel}

In JIRA 5.1.x, custom field with long name are getting truncated in the Issue View screen. Looking further at this behavior, it seems that the issue view will only support custom field name up to 20 characters. For the fields name with more than 20 characters, the name will be truncated. 

Kindly refer to the following sample screenshot which reflects the behavior:
!jira51.png! 

It will be great if we can wrap the field name, the way as it is in JIRA 5.0.x:
!jira50.png!
fields.summary: Long custom field names are truncated in the View Issue screen

fields.description:
Hi,

We are using JIRA 5.1.2 and this problem I writing you about is present since JIRA 5.1.

First: you cannot resize the TinyMCE editor field. The standard textarea field could be resized but not this one.

Second: if you click on the full size icon in TinyMCE, the text's background is transparent and therefore you can't see anything in the field. As you can see in the attachment.

Thank you for your time,
Gábor Nádai
fields.summary: TinyMCE problems with resizing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29669].
  {panel}

It would be great if JIRA kept track of whether a specific issue/comment was created directly via web or via email. I need to understand what channels my customers are using to communicate with me more.

Perhaps this could just be a flag/property of the issue/comment that shows up under the History tab as well?

Of course it should also be accessible via JQL if possible so I can use the standard reporting tools for some initial data mining. I would like to be able to run a query and tell easily that X% of my customers are interacting with me via email, Y% of my customers only use email etc.

In fact, it would be great to have a break down of the volume of the issues/comments that were added using REST API or web interface or email or some other means etc...
fields.summary: Better tracking of the interactions

fields.description:
When creating a user account and leaving the password blank so the user can set a password themselves, the email that arrives has the "Set my password" link pointing at the profile page ({{/secure/ViewProfile.jspa}}) instead of the reset password link ({{/secure/ResetPassword!default.jspa?os_username=<user>&token=<token>}}).

This occurs in both fireball 168.1 and 169.
fields.summary: "Set my password" link in "Account created" emails go to user profile page and not reset password link
JIRA Documentation Links on CAC for v3.13 and earlier are Broken

fields.description:
When using Polish Translation pack, the field name of Description will shown differently. 

If there's _any content_ in the description field, the field name will shown as Polish. If there's _no content_ in the description field, the field name will shown in English.

If using the translation pack with JIRA 5.1.3, the translation of the works fine.

*Workaround:*
Upgrade to JIRA 5.1.3 or above.
fields.summary: Different translation of field name when using Polish language

fields.description:
No Issue type display in select-list when doing a bulk move until a reload the page. This happens only when a project is selected first.

Steps to reproduce:
# Do search search for all issues in one project.
# Start a bulk move for FROM-1 (Bug).
# On "Step 3 of 4: Move Issues: Select Projects and Issue Types" select project "TO". Then the issue type drop down will be empty and shows 'No Matches'.
# Refresh the page
# The rest of issue types for the target project will be show in the select list.
# If you choose the issue type first, then choose the project. It will show the 'No issue type selected' which may related to the bug [JRA-27905|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-27905]
# Select again on the issue type and clicking next again will let you progress through the bulk operation.
fields.summary: No Issue type display in select-list when doing a bulk move until a reload the page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29646].
  {panel}

The project administration page is not ordered consistently. Items on the left hand navigation are not topics on the right side and the ohter way around. Also the ordering is not consistent. See screenshots for more details.

Current behavior:
!aa.jpg|thumbnail!

Expected behavior:
!bb.jpg|thumbnail!

Thanks
fields.summary: Make project administration more consistent

fields.description:
REST endpoints to search groups and to list issue resolutions allow anonymous/unauthenticated access.

The former allows to enumerate all groups on a JIRA instance (by sending multiple queries as results are limited by jira.ajax.autocomplete.limit). We've verified this on an instance without any public projects / groups / whatsoever running version 5.1.1.

For an example see:
https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/groups/picker
https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/resolution
fields.summary: Information disclosure in REST API
"Do Not Notify Me" overrides the Notification Scheme in JIRA

fields.description:
Error on Dashboard screen	

 
The Gadget Dashboard bundled plugin is not available. To ensure the Gadget Dashboard plugin is enabled, please contact your JIRA administrators.

If you think this message is wrong, please contact your JIRA administrators
fields.summary: Error on Dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29642].
  {panel}

h3. Current situation
The Two-Dimensional Filter Gadget can only use filters that have been saved.

h3. Improvement Request
To be able to enter the URL of the search. For example, enter this URL {code}http://localhost:8082/jira/secure/IssueNavigator!executeAdvanced.jspa?jqlQuery=project+%3D+TestC+and+created+%3E+2012&runQuery=true&clear=true{code} into the Two-Dimensional Filter Gadget. This is so that the filter will not have to be saved and the gadget can still be used.
fields.summary: Ability to use filter URL for JIRA Two-Dimensional Filter Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29640].
  {panel}

We need to avoid Cross-site Scripting vulnerabilities. A function should be created to provide server side and client side input validation where applicable. Special characters should be stripped out during the validation process.
The following special characters should be stripped out if unnecessary:
[1] | (pipe sign)
[2] & (ampersand sign)
[3] ; (semicolon sign)
[4] $ (dollar sign)
[5] % (percent sign)
[6] @ (at sign)
[7] ' (single apostrophe)
[8] " (quotation mark)
[9] \' (backslash-escaped apostrophe)
[10] \" (backslash-escaped quotation mark)
[11] <> (triangular parenthesis)
[12] () (parenthesis)
[13] + (plus sign)
[14] CR (Carriage return, ASCII 0x0d)
[15] LF (Line feed, ASCII 0x0a)
[16] , (comma sign)
[17] \ (backslash)

During testing, we found following urls to reproduce the Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities.

https://del-test.sapient.resultspace.com/jira/rest/api/1.0/labels/suggest

Vulnerable Parameters: query, suggest

https://del-test.sapient.resultspace.com/jira/rest/gadget/1.0/createdVsResolved/generate

Vulnerable Parameters : projectOrFilterId

https://del-test.sapient.resultspace.com/jira/rest/gadget/1.0/createdVsResolved/validate

Vulnerable Parameters: projectOrFilterId, validate

https://deltest.sapient.resultspace.com/jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/context-list/generate

Vulnerable Parameters: projectId,generate

https://deltest.sapient.resultspace.com/jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/versionBoardlist/generate

Vulnerable Parameters: projectId, generate

Please find the attachment Cross_Site_Scripting.txt file for details in response.
fields.summary: The JIRA/Crowd applications fail to properly sanitize user input in the query string of the website or in the value of a parameter
Addition Event: MODULE_REFRESHED

fields.description:
When adding New Permission to any Permission Scheme, Group Custom Field Value selector displays more than just Group Single and Multi-Select Custom Fields.  

Confirmed that it incorrectly shows Multi Checkboxes, Multi Select, and Select List.
fields.summary: Incorrect options for Groups Custom Field Values in Permission Schemes
As a website visitor, I would like to submit a screenshot when sending in a issue report/feedback form
Attach File dialog static message: "No file chosen"

fields.description:
On each jira upgrade the installer script will override all files from JIRA_INSTALL even if these do contain essential configuration settings:
/bin/setenv.sh (or bat) - which contains how much memory jira needs, ESSENTIAL!!!
/config/server.xml - web server config, essential
/jre/lib/security/cacerts - trusted CA certs without this, ALL SSL connections like LDAPS, POP3S, IMAPS will be broken after the upgrade.

The upgrade should just upgrade jira. Also because it does archive current install directory it takes too much time. The logs directory shouldn't be archived, it should just be kept.
fields.summary: jira upgrade does override essential configuration files like setenv.sh cacerts and server.xml

fields.description:
We like to use labels starting with a #, a la Twitter hashtags, but these do not show up in your labels gadget. 

Perhaps there's a good reason for this. Obviously this is not a biggy!
fields.summary: Labels Gadget only display labels starting with a letter or a number.
As JIRA Administrator I would like to have audit logs for version changes

fields.description: A query with "created > 2012-08-01" will also return issues created on 2012-08-01. That means that the query is equivalent to "created >= 2012-08-01".
fields.summary: Date comparison operator > (greater-than) issue

fields.description:
h4. Pre-Conditions
* Source project and destination project has custom workflows.
* Custom workflows have custom statuses.
!source-workflow.png!
!destination-workflow.png!

h4. Issue/Reported Bug
When moving an issue with sub-tasks from one project to the next, the parent issue will use the destination project's workflow assigned to the set status. However, its sub-task(s) would not use the destination project's workflow, but uses the default {{jira}} workflow instead.
!moving-issues-status-select.png!

On some occasions, insisting on moving the issue will spew out the following stack trace:
{noformat}
java.lang.RuntimeException: No step associated with status In Progress (Task) in new workflow Deploy Workflow
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.migrateIssueToWorkflowNoReindex(OSWorkflowManager.java:528)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.migrateIssueToWorkflow(OSWorkflowManager.java:488)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.MoveIssueConfirm.migrateIssueToWorkflow(MoveIssueConfirm.java:629)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.MoveIssueConfirm.migrateSubTask(MoveIssueConfirm.java:606)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.MoveIssueConfirm.moveSubTasks(MoveIssueConfirm.java:451)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.MoveIssueConfirm.doExecute(MoveIssueConfirm.java:284)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:82)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39)
	at webwork.interceptor.NestedInterceptorChain.proceed(NestedInterceptorChain.java:31)
	at webwork.interceptor.ChainedInterceptor.intercept(ChainedInterceptor.java:16)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:35)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:221)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:150)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.service(JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.java:153)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:290)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.steps.ChainedFilterStepRunner.doFilter(ChainedFilterStepRunner.java:78)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:235)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.XContentTypeOptionsNoSniffFilter.doFilter(XContentTypeOptionsNoSniffFilter.java:22)
	at com.atlassian.core.filters.AbstractHttpFilter.doFilter(AbstractHttpFilter.java:31)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:235)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
	at com.atlassian.core.filters.HeaderSanitisingFilter.doFilter(HeaderSanitisingFilter.java:44)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:235)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
...
{noformat}

h4. Workaround
# [Convert the sub-task(s) to an issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Creating+a+Sub-Task#CreatingaSub-Task-Convertingasub-tasktoastandardissue].
# Move the converted issue(s) as well as the main issue to the destination project.
# [Convert the converted issue(s) to sub-task(s) again|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Creating+a+Sub-Task#CreatingaSub-Task-Convertingastandardissuetoasub-task].

h4. However...
The workaround may not be feasible when dealing with the following scenarios:
* an issue with lots of subtasks,
* lots of issues with a subtask, or
* lots of issues with lots of subtasks.
fields.summary: Sub-Tasks Not Using Assigned Workflow When Moving Parent Issue To Another Project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29625].
  {panel}

We want to control the server's caching directives from within individual scripts. We have identified following locations, where we can provide HTTP headers 'Cache-control: no-store' and 'Pragma: no-cache'. Please provide these response headers to the following identified locations and to all other pages where the sensitive contents must not be cached on the client.

/jira/includes/blank.html
/jira/plugins/servlet/gadgets/dashboard-diagnostics
/jira/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr
/jira/plugins/servlet/gliffyapi/clientresource
/jira/rest/plugins/1.0/notifications/kbiswas
/jira/s/en_US-jqmja3/729/168/_/favicon.ico
fields.summary: The application should return caching directives instructing browsers not to store local copies of any sensitive data.
Customfield type is now an ArrayList for group picker type

Ability to set default value for contents of standard fields

fields.description:
A user will try and perform a project import where the source and destination systems have identical plugin versions but still receive an error along the lines of:

{noformat}
The backup project 'XYZ' requires custom field named 'Global Rank' with full key 'com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-global-rank'. In the current instance of JIRA the plugin is at version '5.7.4', but in the backup it is at version '5.7.1'.{noformat}

The SE working the case will go and confirm that the user has the identical version of the plugin on both instances. 

We have actually reproduced this internally as well. Procedure is:

# Spin up JIRA + GH.
# Generate garbage data.
# Perform an XML export
# Shut down JIRA
# Remove the GH jar.
# Start JIRA back up.
# Reinstall the same version of GH as before.
# Try and import the project.

I have seen this happen with Fe/Cru and GreenHopper. Other SEs have seen this hit multiple other plugins as long as they create their own custom fields.

This relates to this KB: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Project+Import+Error
fields.summary: Invalid plugin version mismatch during project import

fields.description:
In the source code of Workflow designer delivered with the source code of JIRA is missing the following files:

rw-rr- 1 yilinmo staff 10076 Aug 13 10:33 swfobject-min.js
rw-rr- 1 yilinmo staff 1106671 Aug 13 10:33 jira-workflow-designer-flex-2.6.13.swf
rw-rr- 1 yilinmo staff 1256 Aug 13 10:33 jwd-min.js

Which are delivered with the standalone version and war version of JIRA.

As consequence, the workflow designer plugin is not working correctly after the JIRA is built.
fields.summary: Workflow Designer source is missing from the source code delivered with JIRA source code folder

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29614].
  {panel}

h3. Current situation
Currently, JIRA is set so that even after a custom field is added into the navigator columns in the Administrator page, it might not appear in the search columns (of the issue Navigator). This happens if the project is set to a specific context (a certain project or issue type). If the specific project or issue type is not chosen as the search criteria, it will not appear in the search columns. 

For example, the user have 3 projects, Project A, Project B, Project C, and one custom field, Custom X. Custom X is set to only show in Project A. User then adds Custom X to the Navigator Columns. The user then tries searching in a global context, selecting all projects. Custom X does not appear in the search columns. However, if the user specifies the search to only search in Project A, Custom X will appear in the search columns.

h3. Improvement Request
It would be useful if the custom fields would appear in the search columns regardless of the context of the custom field. So, users won't have to specify the exact project or issues and the custom fields would still appear, as long as they have been added into the Navigator Columns
fields.summary: Allow custom fields to appear in search columns regardless of context
Leaving a comment in the add attachment, link, ... dialog should have a reference to the attachment, link, in the comment on the issue screen
Add a shortcut key to add a private comment...
Severe performance degradation of "Bulk Edit" as "Assignable Users" increases

We have identified some files at the following path, where we need to provide above headers. We are not able to identify the jsp pages or servlet, so that we can provide these headers. Can you please suggest us the exact locations of the pages? If they are servlets, these headers should be provided there.

/jira/plugins/servlet/gadgets/dashboard-diagnostics

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29595].
  {panel}

Please bundle JIRA Admin Helper with JIRA - this will help to cut down support load significantly.

Link to plugin:

* https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-admin-helper-plugin

If JIRA is out of the question we'd like to see it bundled with OnDemand. :)
fields.summary: Bundle JIRA Admin Helper with JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29591].
  {panel}

This issue affects all versions of JIRA up to the present day. To reproduce

i) type a search term into "Quick Search"
ii) press the back button
iii) press the forward button

Some variety of confusing dialogs ensue, but the user does not return to their search. All searches have the URL, for example https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa rather than a URL which is related to the search, of the style that has been popular pretty much since search engines have been invented (e.g. Google). 

In the recent versions of JIRA, we now get the EXTRA dialog from JIRA itself "Unsaved changes - confirm that you want to navigate away" - in addition to the dialogs from the browser "Confirm form resubmission". This is an awkward user experience that interrupts this very common workflow. Please could you supply proper URLs at least for the case of simple searches as has been common in commercial search engines for a long time - it is understandable if complex JQL searches are not bookmarkable and degrade, but it should be possible to supply URL support for a variety of straightforward searches.

Many thanks
fields.summary: Back button does not work correctly in searches (confirm form resubmission dialog)
All on screen failures should include a timestamp

fields.description: When having a long line text in the issue description box, it will over pass the text area instead of split the text into two line, as in the screenshot.
fields.summary: Issue description box do not split the long line paragraph

fields.description:
When creating issues via IE 8 browser, when selecting the priority the custom icon will not be properly rendered. Basically, the icon will become large and is consuming the priority name section.

Kindly refer to the following sample screenshot which is projecting the behavior:
!scshot1.PNG!

Only custom icons are affected by this, and is not reproducible using other browser type (tested on Chrome, Firefox and Safari). 

*Workaround*: Use an icon which is the desired size rather than relying on JIRA's scaling.
fields.summary: Custom priority icon becomes large when creating issues using IE 8 browser

fields.description:
When reindexing Jira does not close the handles on the old index-files properly.
Using {{lsof +L1}} we could identify 6.89GiB of old indexes still open by jira but allready unlinked on the hard-drive.

We run reindexing every night at 3am triggered by a service-task. Right now this means we should better restart Jira every week or two so we don't need a bigger data partition and improve Jira performance.

How to reproduce?
I just now hit "Reindex" inside Jira and after it finished there were 17 new lines in the output of {{lsof +L1}}.

h5. Workaround

# Disable the index optimization job as per our [How to Disable the Index Optimization Job in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Disable+the+Index+Optimization+Job+in+JIRA] KB article. 
(i) This job is not necessary from JIRA 5.0 onwards and was deprecated as of JIRA 5.1.6 (JRA-29487).
# Whenever a *full* reindex is performed on JIRA, restart it afterwards.
fields.summary: Jira does not close handles of old index properly

fields.description:
We migrated our old Jira 4.3 to the latest Jira using the xml import.
The xml import migrated all previously configured dashboards as well. 
So far so good.

But where seems to be a problem with certain (old) gadgets which now display following error:
{code}
Error loading gadget from rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:workloadpie-gadget/com/atlassian/jira/ext/charting/gadget/workloadpie-gadget.xml: org.apache.shindig.gadgets.GadgetException: Unable to retrieve gadget xml. HTTP error 404
{code}


Right now I can't delete these Gadgets from the Dashboard and not even the entire Dashboard on which these old gadgets where defined.

UPDATE:
Installing the Charting widget resolves the error, but it should be possible to delete said gadgets without them...?
fields.summary: Can't delete Widget with org.apache.shindig.gadgets.GadgetException after XML Import
Upgrade to UPM v2.6.x
Bulk add and/or remove values from multi-select fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29582].
  {panel}

h3. Symptom

Attempting to startup JIRA presents the following error:

{noformat}
****************************************************************************************************
Failed to start JIRA due to a build number inconsistency.
The data present in your database is newer than the version of JIRA you are trying to startup.
Database version is: 6096
JIRA app version is: 733
Please use the correct version of JIRA. You are running: 5.0.6#733-sha1:f48fab7a0abaa0a316c14a3fc86cdf5a6805ba12
****************************************************************************************************
{noformat}

(i) The build numbers will vary dependent upon the version of JIRA being used.

h3. Cause

A test/dev/sandbox instance was started up against the same database production is using. This will trigger upgrade tasks to run and will alter the database so that it is setup for the new version. As the check is not performed at runtime, the production instance will not know this has happened until a restart is attempted, at which point the check is executed and the startup will fail.

h3. Workaround

This can be fixed with either of the two options, *after the test/dev/sandbox instance has been pointed to the correct test database*.

# Perform  an emergency upgrade on the production instance to the same version as test as per [Upgrading JIRA|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA].
# Restore an XML backup or database backup from *prior* to the upgrade by the test/dev/sandbox server. One can be found on the test/dev/sandbox instance under {{$JIRA_HOME/export/jira_autoexport_20130530_102302.zip}} (the naming convention will vary as it depends upon the date).

Please note that if the first option is selected the integrity of the database cannot be guaranteed, as JIRA was never designed to have multiple instances utilising the same database. This can cause critical data integrity issues that may be irreparable. 

h3. Resolution

We have seen users frequently connect their test/dev/sandbox instances to the production database accidentally.

The use case is an admin copies their {{$JIRA_HOME}} for testing, but the {{dbconfig.xml}} file is still pointing to their production database. If the {{dbconfig.xml}} file is forgotten to be altered to point at a testing database, when that server starts up it this will then fire off upgrade tasks at the production database from the testing installation if it is on a newer version.

I would like to request a database lock (maybe a table entry to the {{$JIRA_HOME}} lock file, and its pairing {{$JIRA_INSTALL}} directory, or some other method of uniquely identifying an instance) during bootup or some sort of other workaround to avoid the situation of two JIRA installs pointing at one database as this is a common occurrence.
fields.summary: Preventing the "The data present in your database is newer than the version of JIRA you are trying to startup." using a Database Lock

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29581].
  {panel}

Currently we get a lot of support cases due to plugins and anecdotally I have seen a lot of them relating specifically to upgrades. Often when a customer upgrades they will leave their old plugins in {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} and this can cause a number of problems during that upgrade process. We have even had one of our experts even get confused about this in the docs and raise a support case about it.

Specifically, there's some differences between docs as outlined below and it can be a bit confusing.

Both [Upgrading JIRA|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA] and [Migrating JIRA to Another Server|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server] have the following in the Before You Start section:

{quote}
If you have installed any additional JIRA plugins (i.e. not included with JIRA), please verify that they will be compatible with the version of JIRA you are upgrading to. You can find a plugin's compatibility information from the the plugin's home page on the [Atlassian Plugin Exchange|https://marketplace.atlassian.com]. Once you have confirmed the availability of compatible versions, you should upgrade your plugins after successfully upgrading JIRA. This can be done via the *'Plugin Repository'* in your *Administration Console*.
{quote}

And then [Upgrading JIRA Manually|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+Manually] has the following in section 3.2:

{quote}
* *Plugins*— For any plugins that you had installed in your old JIRA:
*# Download the plugin version for your new version of JIRA from the [http://plugins.atlassian.com] site.
*# [Install the JAR file(s)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+JIRA%27s+Plugins] in your new JIRA, and carry out any other required installation for the plugin.
*# If the plugin has a properties file, apply the same changes to it as you had in the old properties file (don't just copy over the old properties file).
{quote}

And [Migrating JIRA to Another Server|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server] has the following in section 3.2:

{quote}
* *Plugins* — For any plugins that you had installed in your old JIRA, download the plugin version for your new version of JIRA from the [http://plugins.atlassian.com] site.
{quote}

----

The main problem here is that if the customer follows the first piece of the docs, they can proceed with an upgrade that can cause problems on their JIRA instance. For example, if they try to upgrade and restore an XML backup that requires a custom field from a plugin, and that plugin isn't enabled because the plugin was disabled due to being incompatible the upgrade process can fail.

If they follow the [Upgrading JIRA Manually|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+Manually] part in 3.2, this is the best suggestion as it will get them to upgrade their plugins manually on the new install by putting the new JARs into {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} before starting up JIRA, and they can avoid incompatibility problems (unless they install the wrong version).

It doesn't clearly list to do it that way, and I'm wondering if you can modify both [Upgrading JIRA Manually|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+Manually] and [Migrating JIRA to Another Server|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server] so it would have something like the following, maybe even in its own section:

{quote}
h3. Plugins

Prior to starting JIRA up, it is important to ensure the new version has the correct plugins installed. Any incompatibilities can cause significant problems during the upgrade - to avoid this, please follow the below instructions to upgrade your plugins manually:

# Manually move all your plugins from {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} to a temporary directory.
# Check the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com] for the most recent version of the plugin that is compatible with the new JIRA version.
# Download that plugin JAR and install it into the {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} directory.
# Repeat steps 2-3 for each of your plugins.
# After installing all the new versions of the plugins, start the new version of JIRA up.
{quote}

Perhaps this isn't the ideal way of doing it, however it should help provide more information to customers on the impact their plugins can have on upgrading, and also get them to manually upgrade the plugins before upgrading so as to reduce the number of support issues we get.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Upgrading JIRA Documentation: Plugins

fields.description:
Depending on the browser, form submit / cancel does not trigger when the access key is pressed on JIRA dialogues / pages on Mac OS X.

Below is observations of the above unexpected behaviour:

|| Mac OS X 10.7.4 ||
|| Browser || Save Inline Edit || Cancel Inline Edit form || Submit Edit Issue Dialogue Form || Cancel Edit Issue Dialogue || Submit Assign Issue Dialogue form || Cancel Assign Issue Dialogue || 
| Firefox (15) | (x) | (x) | (x) | (x) | (x) | (x) |
| Chrome (23.0.1246.0 dev) | (/) | (x) | (/) | (x) | (/) | (x) |
| Safari (6.0) | (/) | (x) | (/) | (x) | (/) | (x) |

These access keys are advertised to the user upon hover over, and should trigger form submit / cancel appropriately on Mac OS X.
fields.summary: Access Keys do not trigger form submit / cancel on Mac OS X depending on browser
Raise threshold for log messages from plugin system

fields.description:
The "session expiry" and "XSRF token missing" pages will echo any submitted values. This may result in echoing the submitted password to the page in plain text if triggered on the WebSudo authentication page.

Modify the error pages (session_expired.jsp and xsrf_missing.jsp) so they don't echo parameters whose names contain password. 

To reproduce, go to a wedsudo prompt, then log out in another tab, then submit the websudo form. Your password will be echoed back to you.
fields.summary: Session expiry pages may echo password in clear text

fields.description:
When i send an email from a windows machine to generate tickets, the subject line is not decoded correctly. We get Tickets with subjects like "=?us-ascii?Q?Account disabled?=" or "=?utf-8?Q?Account disabled?=".

Mail-Client such as Outlook display the correct subject line "Account disabled".

Is this a known behaviour or are there plans to change it?
fields.summary: MailFetcherService does not decode E-Mail subject properly

fields.description:
Few gadgets will be reload when zoom in/out dashboard page, e.g:'Projects', but some gadgets are not reloading when performing the same action. e.g: 'Filter Results'

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a filter 'A' from issue navigator.
# Create a project 'ABC'.
# Add gadget 'Filter Results' on the dashboard and use filter 'A'.
# Add gadget 'Projects' on the dashboard and set to 'All projects'.
# Create an issue which belong to filter 'A' in a new Tab.
# Create a new project 'XYZ' in a new tab.
# Go to the dashboard tab page, Zoom in/out or Maximize/restore the browser.

The 'filter result' will not be reload, it will stay still with the old data. 

The 'projects' will reload and the project 'XYZ' will be showing in the gadget.
fields.summary: Few gadget will be refresh when zoom in/out dashboard page
Collapsing All Comments at Once

fields.description:
In JIRA 4.3.1 it was possible to render media attachments in issue comments. Tested both mp3 and wmv file types.

This throws and error in the comment when running JIRA 5.1:
audio file: "Unable to embed resource: knees.mp3 of type audio/mpeg"
video file: "Unable to embed resource: vid.wmv of type application/octet-stream"

See attachments.
fields.summary: Media files not rendering

fields.description:
When editing an issue (edit any field), the value for a Read-Only custom field is removed automatically. 

Reproducing this requires a CSV import and Upgrade:
# Run JIRA 4.4
# Create a custom field type Import ID
# Import a CSV file and map one of the CSV fields to the newly created custom field (Type Import ID)
** Make sure that the value are exported. Import ID custom field requires an integer value.
** Use the bundled JIM version
# Create an XML backup 
# Restore the JIRA 4.4 backup to JIRA 5.1
# Access the imported issue on JIRA 5.1 and edit a any field (Ie. description).  This process will remove the value for the Import ID custom field

Tested on 5.1 and 5.1.3

Attach a video of this behavior: [jra-29551|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/70580/jra-29551.mp4]
fields.summary: The Value for Custom Field (Type Read Only) is Automatically Removed Upon Editing an Issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29550].
  {panel}

At the moment, the Excel export is accessible by all users. Since there is possibility that user has triggered this feature very frequently, this might cause slowness in the instance. 

Therefore, it will be nice to have if:
* there permission exist to restrict this feature to certain groups
* there is an option to disable this feature
* there any limit of total number of Excel export can be generated per minute

h3. Workaround 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-disable-export-feature-856835486.html
fields.summary: Ability To Restrict or Limit or Disabling the Excel Export

fields.description:
Let's say I have a user with username "johndoe" and display name "John Doe". 

When entering a comment, typing @john will suggest (correctly) "John Doe - john@doe.com (johndoe)". Selecting that user from the suggest, it will insert "[~johndoe] into my comment. All good so far. 

When I add the comment, plain-text of "[~johndoe]" is contained in the comment, and not a hyperlink/reference to the John Doe user. 

(I manage two JIRA instances, one of them behaves how I'd expect and hyperlinks "John Doe" to the user.. But this instance in question doesn't behave this way)
fields.summary: User mentions don't expand to show full display names

fields.description:
Hi,

any user that make change in issue make the user a watcher of this issue.

before, this problem didn't exist. I need to change this and that a user is watcher only if requested.
fields.summary: every change in issue makes me a watcher

fields.description:
When renaming a workflow transition where the workflow was copied from the default workflow, the name is not reflected in the issue view page. 

Note: It seems only happens for workflows copied from the default.

h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Copy the default workflow and added your prefer name on the copied workflow.
# In the copied workflow, go to one of the step's transition(eg. In Progress of Open step) and rename it to your prefer name.
# Associate the new copied workflow to a workflow scheme and then associate to a project.
# Create a new issue and proceed to the status where the transition name was changed. The transition button will still remain the old transition name.

h5. Causes:
The *transition-id number* still same although the name is changed

h5. Workarounds:
Delete the old transition of the copied workflow and add a new one, which will change the *transition-id*.
fields.summary: Rename in default transition from copied default workflow not reflected in issue view

fields.description:
When serving images, JIRA appears to be appending charset=UTF-8 to the content-type header.  For example, if you load https://jira.atlassian.com/images/icons/improvement.gif and examine the http headers, you will find 
Content-Type	image/gif;charset=UTF-8 

Is suspect this is the root cause of some of the IE8 bugs we see about not displaying icons.
fields.summary: JIRA is appending charset=UTF-8 to images

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29542].
  {panel}

Hi there

We have a script schedule to run every night at 00:02 AM to rebuild the subversion integration indexes. In the process it shutdown the Jira first, delete and rebuild the indexes and finally startup the Jira.

However at the stage when it finally try to start Jira, it faile dto start smoothly. The error which comes in the catalina.out file shows the jira home directory is locked as below.


The jira.home directory '/data/jiraprod' is already locked. Please see http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/docs-042/How+do+I+unlock+my+JIRA+home+directory%3F?clic
ked=jirahelp# for more information on locked jira.home directories.


******************************************
JIRA startup failed, JIRA has been locked.
******************************************

Then jira failed to start. In most of the ocassions when I checked the Jira home directory, I don't find out any jira-home.lock. So finally the solution is to manually restart the jira.

Its happening nowadays quite frequently. Could you please guide me if you have any solution to avoid the locking of Jira directory.

Thanks
Ashish
fields.summary: Script Fails to start Jira
NullPointerException in MentionsService
Created and Updated fields do not show timestamp

fields.description:
Issue Statistics gadget does not handle a select list as the statistic type with natural order sorting. Result is some of the options are missing.

Steps to reproduce:

Create Project1.
Create Project2.
Create Field1 of type Select List, in my testing the search template did not matter.
Create a separate context for Project1 and for Project2. Include all issue types for both.
Add a set of options to each project. They should not overlap in name. When I did this, I had 5 options in Project1 and 6 in Project2.
Create multiple issues, until most of the options have been used 2+ times. Leave some options completely unused in each project. Project1 had 2 unused, and Project2 had 1 unused in my test.
Create a filter such as "project in (Project1,Project2)" and save it.
Create an Issue Statistics gadget. Select the appropriate filter, set the statistics type to Field1. Sort by Natural. Sort direction descending. Show resolved issue statistics Yes. Refresh Interval never.
Notice that only some of the values from Field1 show up.
Change the Sort by to Total and all of the values show up.

QED ∎
fields.summary: Issue Statistics Gadget has inconsistent behavior
JIRA System Administrator permissions(eg. save filter)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29537].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

It would be useful if the user could view multiple workflows graphically, so that the workflows can be compared. Some users have a lot of workflows, so it can be quite troublesome if the user has to view each workflow individually.

It would be even better if the user could compare workflows step by step like this :

{noformat}
Workflow A      Workflow B
Step A1         Step B1
Step A2         Step B2
...             ...
...             ...
...             ...
{noformat}
fields.summary: View or compare workflows graphically
